channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: People firing litter into 6he ait with no idea where it's going to land. This is littering., 20th October
item.description:
Unfortunately no category for noise nuisance, so reporting 3rd night of fireworks in a row in Barnehurst area. More and more use outside of 5th Nov in recent yrs. Besides well-documented noise impact on wildlife, pets, military vets, kids sleeping and general public, this is also wilful littering. People responsible just randomly throwing yet more litter into wider environment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thirlmere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadwork traffic light phasing leading to blocked road, 20th October
item.description:
Hi there. The traffic light phasing of the roadworks is leading to tailbacks in both directions with traffic blocked on with on the road. This phasing needs to be reexamined as it's causing severe congestion.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 120, Lower Road, Rotherhithe, London

item.title: Tree overhanging onto public footpath, 20th October
item.description:
The tree in this garden in St Johnâ€™s Road is overhanging so far onto the public footpath that it is restricting the public right of way on the pavement and it is almost impossible to walk past if pushing a pram or buggy or if in a wheelchair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Johns Road, Albany Park, London

item.title: Road markings are incorrect, 20th October
item.description:
This road (Bunhill Row) is two way for bicycles. However, there is no give way line painted at the end going southbound. It's painted only as entry, meaning there is no safe space for bicycles going south to turn out of the road. Cars can cut across the whole road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bunhill Row, Finsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 25 chalk farm road Nw1 8ag, 20th October
item.description:
Dear Camden Council Highways Team, I am reporting an active water leak beneath the public pavement directly outside 25 Chalk Farm Road, London NW1 8AG. The leak is entering my commercial basement premises (Cloud Health and Beauty Ltd) through the pavement-side wall and has already caused substantial damage. Thames Water have acknowledged the issue and have scheduled an engineer visit this evening under Case No. 01353979 (linked to their admitted Claim Ref 6236398). Given that the leak originates under the pavement, I am requesting that Camden Council: 1. Log this as a defective highway / suspected underground mains leak under your duties pursuant to Sections 81â€“82 Highways Act 1980; 2. Liaise directly with Thames Water to ensure the external defect is fully repaired and the pavement made safe; and 3. Confirm inspection or referral details and provide me with a Camden reference number for my records. I am attaching recent photographs and video evidence of the active ingress within my premises, which corresponds to the pavement line. Thank you for your urgent attention. Please confirm receipt and advise once an inspection or referral has been made. Kind regards,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chalk Farm Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
